author: Tonya Perry
comment: I like it for Android Auto  better than Google Play Music. Only con is you can't delete stuff from the player without deleting it feom your phone. For instance my ringtones are in the player and I want to remove them but I can't because it deletes it from my phone. Basically a really good app.    Update: Still having problems with Android Auto. Of course no one wants to admit they're at fault. Time to find a new app.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: To remove unwanted files from your library, go to Folders view, tap on the 3-dot menu next to the folder that contains unwanted files and select "Ban Folder". EDIT: unfortunately, developers have extremely limited options when it comes to Android Auto because it's controlled by Google. Google seems to currently have a bug affecting large media sets

author: Joseph Simoneau
comment: Great, easy app to leverage all those years of downloading mp3s!   Curious if anyone else has issues with delays between tracks? Maybe it's just buffering, but there's usually a sizable wait between each file.  EDIT: Didn't find that cache setting until developer mentioned it. This seems to have solved the issue. Great app! Thanks for the quick response!

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Any delay between tracks is usually due to buffering and depends on network conditions. You could try caching tracks offline and/or increasing the cache size in the Settings.

author: Jeff Freeman
comment: This app is the solution to a significant problem in my life. I store all of my digital music on OneDrive, and it's a lot. Much more than even a robust SD card could handle, especially if I want that SD card for other types of storage. After searching many, many apps, this one did what I needed it to do. It streams from my OneDrive perfectly, and when I need music on my device for faster access, I can do that as needed. As a professional musician and music educator, I need this app. It makes my life happy!

author: Kyle Pollitt
comment: Haven't purchased (yet) but so far so good! This not only plays all the music stored on my Google drive account, but it also found album art and band photos I didn't even have saved in the folders. Music quality is great too! Will probably be purchasing!

author: Onno Verkerk
comment: Everything is there so i bought it. But now i see it is draining the battery. Probably because it scans my OneDrive automagically? Tips: 1) streaming over 3g is ok, but please do the house keeping over Wi-Fi only (during night?), and 2) please do something about the battery drain. I give you 5 stars if you do !

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: The only time the app would use more than normal battery power is after initial setup when it needs to extract metadata & artwork from large numbers of songs/albums. Subsequent scans are incremental and should only use minimal amounts of power. It's also possible you experienced some odd one-time Android issue so I suggest you reboot your phone.

author: Iahel Cathartes Aura
comment: Very well done player! Saved my playlists when in thought they were lost forever! I esp like that it shows how many songs & how many minutes/hours a playlist has. I need an amazing, super professional, advanced, dependable player for my job as a therapist. Will buy pro version soon. Thank you, doubleTwist!!

author: Mike Claiborne
comment: Love it! Great way to play my music on Google Drive and cast to speakers around my house. Only problem is that it takes a really long time to do initial sync (several days for me) and the directory organization is a little screwed up in the app. (I have 20k songs.) Other than that, great app and I am glad I got it.

author: Philip Staniland
comment: As soon as I paid for it I started having problems with it. Album art no longer appears. It shows on the lock screen even when it should have been closed, and Android reports it using excessive battery.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: First, reboot your phone and relaunch the app to make sure it's not some weird Android issue. If it happens again, please come by our forum and post more details so we can investigate: https://plus.google.com/communities/102684141461061984604

author: Chris Chris
comment: Best app for large cloud library. flawlessly synced my onedrive music lib. Tags, artwork etc all w/o any problems. Tried many other apps also on ipad (flacbox etc) they mostly failed. This is a star. If devs would implement high-res play over USB into external DAC/Amp for audiophile headphones this app would be the leading audio superstar b/c Neutron player or USB player pro don't support cloud libraries.

author: Abigail Westfall
comment: I'm pretty pleased with the app. However, one issue is that some of my longer songs will get cut off way before they are over. Is there a way to fix this?

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: This may happen if your phone is putting your WiFi chip to sleep in order to preserve battery. Make sure you white list CloudPlayer from any battery or power saving scheme and don't run any task killers or similar apps. Battery settings can be usually configured in Settings - Battery - Battery Usage - More - Optimize Battery Usage - All Apps

author: Knott Nyce
comment: Not a bad app ,quite good but sometimes when I want leave it playing some of recently added songs playlist it seems to skip past a couple and go on to the next song and I don't know why. All the songs are all in the same format so can't understand why it does this, hence the three Star rating.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: CloudPlayer skips songs when there's a network issue. This can include anything from your WiFi or mobile network to temporary issues on the Dropbox/OneDrive/Google Drive data centers in your geographical location. The logs can contain details about the exact cause. You can send us a copy right after it happens by going to Settings - Send Log Files.

author: Asterisk
comment: I usually want to be able to access my music from the cloud, but I've found it rather annoying that Google only lets me add music using Chrome. This app solves pretty much all problems I have so far with default music players, which is that I can't edit the mp3 tags nor the album covers, whereas with this one I can. Pretty much checks all the boxes.

author: Jett vW
comment: Great and fluid app. It would be convenient if there was a universal search bar that searched through albums, artists, album artists, songs, playlists. Just would quicken things up when searching. Other than that, very good.

author: Edgar Rojas
comment: One star less for terrible developer response! I WROTE THAT EQUALIZER SHOULD BE FREE and they responded they aren't a big company like Google to provide a free equilizer just like Google does. HOWEVER, you already have the equilizer, you can provide it for free. WHAT IS MORE, WE AREN'T ASKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL EQUILIZER. You can provide a free equilizer just like Google does, and provide the premium equilizer for people who buys the app!

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Send us a message at https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/requests/new and reference this comment. Thanks!

author: Faraday Mochama
comment: I've been using it for a while now and generally it's a great app. No other cloud streamig app comes even close. However I have noted two rather annoying issues: 1. I've set it to autoplay when I plug in my earphones and when I do that but forget to turn on wifi or data (I've allowed it to play using mobile data) first, the app literally freezes my phone. It appears to rapidly skip from one song to the next trying to play but fails and ends up hogging the phone memory and processor. I can't do anything at that point except to restart the phone. 2. Sometimes it fails to go to the next track on my playlist and simply stops so I have to press play again for it to resume.

author: Lena Thompson
comment: That app was awesome. Didn't know it has radios, instead of other radio stations from Google Play Music. That was way on the 'A-List'.

author: Ngametua-Tiare Brider
comment: Had to restart then factory data reset my device just to be sure, but after all that which was worth it, I found my music. Once you have all your songs etc; the app is great! Better than Spotify and Google Play Music. If you can't keep up with the payments for YouTube Red then this is definitely a great alternative :-) big thumbs up!

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: If you don't see music that's stored locally on your phone, go to Settings, select "Scan Local Folder" and navigate to the folder where your music is stored. Here's a help page with detailed instructions: https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001021472-How-to-scan-for-missing-local-songs-or-playlists

author: Gary Watts
comment: I apologise, I was referring to your product Doubletwist Sync, which works with Cloudplayer but only supports iTunes. However, I'm growing unhappy with the customer service to be honest at this point, as both replies to my review and others there seems to be an abrupt and unfriendly attitude which has put me off paying for your product at all at this point.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Sorry, but you're mixing different products in your review. doubleTwist Sync is a desktop app which syncs with doubleTwist Player. CloudPlayer on the other hand is meant to be used with music uploaded to a cloud account like Dropbox, OneDrive or Google Drive. I don't think pointing this out makes us "unfriendly". We're just trying to be precise.

author: Praveen Khunte
comment: Syncing with Dropbox, for 1800 songs, took 2 hours. Great, as it did this silently in background. Search is fast. Streaming is almost instantaneous.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Please update to the latest version of the app as it contains fixes for the issues you experienced.  Thanks!

author: Michael Burke
comment: Amazing. I don't have to download music onto my device. It pulls my personal catalog from the cloud (in my case Dropbox). It's like my own personal Spotify for the music that I actually own digitally. Been using it for years and thought I'd finally give a 5 star review :-)

author: Matthew Hazelbaker
comment: I've been using CloudPlayer for quite some time, and I can confidently say this app is everything I had hoped for. The cloud support works flawlessly, updating your library & streaming files in a matter of seconds!

author: Kevin Martin Salzburg-Felts
comment: I really loved this app.  However I REALLY need a Desktop app to, so I can truly have my music everywhere.  I've have to start using Groove  because it has this.  But I would REALLY like to use Cloud Player instead!!

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: This is something that's part of our future plans :) To stay up to date on new features and developments, keep an eye on our private beta group: https://plus.google.com/communities/114410062688956839568

author: Hector Berrios
comment: The only problem I found is that this app does not read music in micro sd card in chromebook.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Not sure if Chromebooks support this but have you tried using the "Scan Local Folder" option in the Settings? Here's a related help page: https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001021472-How-to-scan-for-missing-local-songs-or-playlists

author: Roy Fremouw
comment: Enjoy the app, however I can't seem to be able to grant permission to delete files on my Huawei P8 Lite, however this might be more of a issue with my phone than with the app.

author: Rene Carvalho
comment: Perfect for who has songs on Onedrive! Used to use Groove app from Microsoft but now...

author: Dan Abraham
comment: Unbelievable how the giants like Apple Music and Google Play Music are flooded with errors and this simple app just do what it should be. Whoever you are, thank you!

author: K. Hinds
comment: It works. Very few issues. I have been using it for over a year and a half.

author: Phillip Baggett
comment: Not free. Name is Cloudplayer, but costs $8 to link a cloud account. Completely useless and mislabeled.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: We clearly state in our description - twice - that the basic app is free and we have a 30 day free trial for premium features. We don't pollute our app with annoying ads and rely on user upgrades to pay the bills and feed the office cat.

author: cesar rivera rivera
comment: Page el servicio para poder reproducir las canciones desde la nuve y no reconoce ninguna cancion ni de drive ni dropbox. No sincroniza nada

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: CloudPlayer has built in deduplication logic, meaning it won't import tracks from the cloud if it detects a preexisting copy stored on the phone or SD card. Here's more help: https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002066751-Some-of-my-cloud-files-don-t-show-up-in-CloudPlayer-but-they-appear-on-my-Dropbox-OneDrive-Google-Drive-

author: Thomas Leiss
comment: Why was it changed that the app saves it state? Now it always starts with the default screen. Lyrics would be nice.

author: robin ghertner
comment: Took forever to index my files and quit halfway through. Gotta be a better app out there that doesn't require going through log files to find missing songs.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: CloudPlayer extracts metadata from your cloud files to get artwork, track numbers, etc. This can take 2-3 seconds per file and is only done once. If you are missing songs, read this: https://support.doubletwist.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002066751-Some-of-my-cloud-files-don-t-show-up-in-CloudPlayer-but-they-appear-on-my-Dropbox-OneDrive-Google-Drive-

author: Richard Wood
comment: I am still very new to the app so I can't give a fair opinion.

author: Martin Davies
comment: Simply wonderful. If you want to keep your own music library and use it across different devices then I think this is one of the best options.

author: sushnata panda
comment: After some time music from list are unplayable.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Are you a premium user or do you have an expired free trial? If you're a premium user, this is most likely an issue with your network or your cloud provider and not the app. Which cloud service are you using? Have you tried un-linking and re-linking your account?

author: Martin Nyaga
comment: The app is great but I wish they had a better way of grouping artists and tracks. Especially in the case of similar artists, different albums/tracks.

author: Gheorghe Jianu
comment: The app has a radio with which we can receive an impressive number of radio stations. The sound capability is excellent for both the radio and the MP3 player. Thank you for this product!

author: Elvyn Morales-Perez
comment: Oh, no I didn't. Thanks, I didn't really know what it ment.

reply.author: doubleTwist ™
reply.content: Have you tried the "Scan Cloud Storage" option in the Settings?

author: Martin Shakeshaft
comment: Over an excellent music app. Simple to use and everything works. Had to hunt for hiding folders/albums it's in folder view. Now my music player of choice.

author: anwar morse
comment: Probably the best music player. It has a good interface and an adequate search function. Shuffles and unshuffles my library correctly.

author: Marco Almerigogna
comment: Quite good, but I am still meddling with details, I,'ll review the evaluation once I am through (hopefully 5 stars)
